The rain shadow effect occurs when moist air from the ocean is forced to rise over a mountain range, resulting in the cooling and condensation of the air, which in turn causes the precipitation to fall on the windward side of the mountain. Consequently, the leeward side of the mountain receives significantly less precipitation due to the reduced moisture content in the air.
